```{r load-dataset, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(plyr) #package for rbind.fill command which automatically fills missing values with NA

#Do we want to only look at two years, or look at all the years, looking at just two years would be much simpler, but looking at more years might be more interesting.
report_2015 <- read_csv("data/2015.csv") %>% 
  mutate(year = "2015")
report_2016 <- read_csv("data/2016.csv") %>% 
  mutate(year = "2016")
report_2017 <- read_csv("data/2017.csv") %>% 
  mutate(year = "2017")
report_2018 <- read_csv("data/2018.csv") %>% 
  mutate(year = "2018")
report_2019 <- read_csv("data/2019.csv") %>% 
  mutate(year = "2019")
report_2020 <- read_csv("data/2020.csv") %>% 
  mutate(year = "2020")

worldhappiness <- rbind.fill(report_2015, report_2016, report_2017, report_2018, report_2019, report_2020)
```
